repnme.cdata!:
Croatia - Railway Modernization and
            Restructuring Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is modest; and both Bank
            and Borrower performances are satisfactory. The report notes
            the complexity of implementing a far reaching restructuring
            of the railways, particularly when staff retrenchment and
            reduction in passenger services is required; it requires a
            significant amount political capital and can be greatly
            affected by political instability. Other significant lessons
            cited include: the need to maintain consistent focus and
            pressure on the reform in order to assist the Government
            with weathering political pressures and prevent backsliding;
            the need to involve the labor unions early and obtain their
            views on the retrenchment process; and the need to prepare
            public opinion gradually for the curtailment of the most
            expensive services. Although there was a genuine commitment
            to the project by both the Borrower and the Implementation
            Agency there were also differences in opinions with the Bank
            about how to interpret project development objectives, which
            affected the implementation. The following lessons should be
            addressed in future projects: It is important for the Bank
            to get a clear agreement from the Government on the kind of
            railways the country wants to have and can afford; the
            incumbent railways cannot reasonably be expected to drive
            the process without strong Government leadership. When
            higher Government functionaries are made members of the
            Supervisory Board of the railways, their position should be
            treated "ex officio"; otherwise, the presence of
            these representatives can seriously diminish the capacities
            of the Ministries to provide oversight and to provide
            critical comment.

repnme.cdata!:
Croatia - Railway Modernization and
            Restructuring Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Railway Modernization and
            Restructuring Project seeks to modernize and restructure
            Hrvatske Zeljeznice (HZ) in order to diminish its deficit
            and thus also its financial burden on the budget while
            creating a company adapted to a competitive transport
            market. There are seven project components. First, track
            renewal and maintenance of core routes will help strengthen
            the existing profitable transit traffic, strengthen the
            prospects of new traffic, and decrease maintenance costs.
            Second, rehabilitation of traction units and spare parts
            will allow daily availability of the rehabilitated traction
            units to reach at least 80 percent. Third, conversion of
            freight wagons will provide full side-access and
            strengthened floors for pallets, which will allows HZ to
            increase its presence on revenue generating segments of the
            freight transport market. Fourth, rehabilitation of
            passenger coaches will preserve the availability of
            passenger cars for service through overhaul of these
            coaches. Fifth, environment protection will mitigate
            potential negative impacts on the environment. Sixth,
            severance payment will match the number of staff assigned to
            a specific activity to the actual demand. The last component
            will implement efficiency improvement measures at the
            company's management and organizational levels.
